11 //-----------------------------PLATFORM DIRECTIVES------------------------------
12 
13 // These directives are used for determining what platform this code is being
14 // compiled for. While it may look at little strange that they are initially
15 // defined and then undefined again if they are not valid: this is done solely
16 // so correct Doxygen docs can be built for the preprocessor no matter what
17 // platform Doxygen is running from.
18 
23 #define CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
24 // clean up so code can still run as expected
25 #ifndef _WIN32
26  #undef CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
27 #else
28  // need to do this if using windows so we can use std::min and std::max
29  #define NOMINMAX
30 #endif
31 
36 #define CHAOS_OS_UNIX
37 // clean up so code can still run as expected
38 #if !defined( __APPLE__ ) && !defined( __linux ) && !defined( __unix )
39  #undef CHAOS_OS_UNIX
40 #endif

87 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_CONSTRUCTION( type_name ) \
88  type_name() = delete; \
89  type_name( const type_name& ) = delete; \
90  void operator=( const type_name& ) = delete
91 
102 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN( type_name ) \
103  type_name( const type_name& ) = delete; \
104  void operator=( const type_name& ) = delete

138 #define CHAOS_FOR_EACH(it, collection) \
139  for (auto it = collection.begin(); it != collection.end(); ++it)
140 
141 //--------------------------------CONST FOR EACH--------------------------------
142 
151 #define CHAOS_CONST_FOR_EACH(it, collection) \
152  for (auto it = collection.cbegin(); it != collection.cend(); ++it)
153 
154 //--------------------------------PRINT ITERABLE--------------------------------
155 
164 #define CHAOS_PRINT_ITERABLE( collection ) \
165  std::cout << "[ "; \
166  for ( auto it = collection.begin(); it != collection.end(); ++it ) \
167  { \
168  std::cout << *it << ", "; \
169  } \
170  std::cout << "]" << std::endl
